alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 9:31AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, southern Putnam and northeastern Lincoln Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 930 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tornado, or 8 miles east of Hamlin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Poca, Cross Lanes, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, Coal Fork, Teays Valley, Sod, Griffithsville and Yawkey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 115. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 43 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 94 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 65 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
